description: Create test BRD file with sample SDLC workflow content
details: Create a minimal but representative test-brd.md file in the plans/ directory  that contains a simple feature request suitable for testing the complete SDLC workflow  pipeline.
steps: Step 1: Create plans/test-brd.md with basic structure (title, problem, solution,  requirements)
Step 2: Ensure content is simple enough to complete within 10-minute constraint
Step 3: Include all necessary sections for successful BRD-to-PRD transformation
Step 4: Verify file can be read by brd-to-prd skill
acceptance: Criterion 1: test-brd.md exists in plans/ directory
Criterion 2: File contains all required BRD sections
Criterion 3: Content is appropriate for quick end-to-end test
Criterion 4: brd-to-prd skill can successfully parse the file

description: Design test workflow command structure and entry point
details: Define the command-line interface for the test workflow, including command name,   arguments (--project-name, --yolo), and integration points with Ralph's existing CLI  infrastructure.
steps: Step 1: Determine command structure (e.g., 'ralph test' or 'ralph validate-workflow')
Step 2: Define required and optional arguments (project-name, yolo flag)
Step 3: Design output format specifications for both modes
Step 4: Document command interface and expected behavior
acceptance: Criterion 1: Command structure is documented
Criterion 2: Arguments are clearly defined with types and defaults
Criterion 3: Output format specifications exist for interactive and --yolo modes
Criterion 4: Integration approach with existing Ralph CLI is specified

description: Define project context and name resolution mechanism
details: Establish how project_name is stored, resolved, and passed between workflow  phases to ensure all skills can access it without manual specification.
steps: Step 1: Determine project context storage mechanism (config file, environment, session  state)
Step 2: Define resolution order (CLI arg > config > default)
Step 3: Specify interface for skills to access project_name
Step 4: Document project context lifecycle (creation, usage, cleanup)
acceptance: Criterion 1: Project context storage approach is defined
Criterion 2: Resolution logic is documented with priority order
Criterion 3: Interface for skills to access project_name exists
Criterion 4: Context lifecycle is clearly specified

description: Implement test workflow command entry point
details: Create the main command handler that orchestrates the complete test workflow,  supporting both interactive and --yolo execution modes.
steps: Step 1: Create command handler function in Ralph CLI
Step 2: Implement argument parsing for --project-name and --yolo
Step 3: Add workflow orchestration logic to call phases in sequence
Step 4: Implement error handling and timeout enforcement (10 minutes)
Step 5: Add progress tracking and status reporting
acceptance: Criterion 1: Command executes when invoked from CLI
Criterion 2: Arguments are correctly parsed and validated
Criterion 3: Workflow phases execute in correct order
Criterion 4: Execution stops after 10 minutes with timeout error
Criterion 5: Errors are caught and reported clearly

description: Implement BRD to PRD validation flow
details: Create workflow phase that reads test-brd.md, invokes brd-to-prd skill,  validates output, and handles confirmation in interactive mode.
steps: Step 1: Read test-brd.md from plans/ directory
Step 2: Invoke brd-to-prd skill with project context
Step 3: Validate generated PRD has required sections
Step 4: In interactive mode, prompt for confirmation; in --yolo mode, auto-proceed
Step 5: Store PRD path for next phase
acceptance: Criterion 1: test-brd.md is successfully read
Criterion 2: brd-to-prd skill executes without errors
Criterion 3: Generated PRD contains all required sections
Criterion 4: Interactive mode waits for user confirmation
Criterion 5: --yolo mode proceeds automatically

description: Implement PRD to tasks validation flow
details: Create workflow phase that reads generated PRD, invokes prd-to-tasks skill,  creates tasks in Vibe-Kanban, and validates task creation.
steps: Step 1: Read generated PRD from previous phase
Step 2: Invoke prd-to-tasks skill with project context
Step 3: Parse generated task JSON array
Step 4: Create tasks in Vibe-Kanban via API with proper dependencies
Step 5: Validate all tasks were created and display task list
acceptance: Criterion 1: PRD is successfully read and parsed
Criterion 2: prd-to-tasks skill generates valid JSON task array
Criterion 3: All tasks are created in Vibe-Kanban
Criterion 4: Task dependencies are correctly set
Criterion 5: Task list is displayed to user

description: Implement task execution validation with dependency ordering
details: Create workflow phase that retrieves tasks from Vibe-Kanban, executes them in  dependency order, and tracks execution status.
steps: Step 1: Retrieve tasks from Vibe-Kanban for the project
Step 2: Build dependency graph and determine execution order
Step 3: Execute tasks sequentially respecting dependencies
Step 4: Update task status in Vibe-Kanban as tasks complete
Step 5: Handle task failures and report status
acceptance: Criterion 1: Tasks are retrieved from Vibe-Kanban
Criterion 2: Execution order respects all dependencies
Criterion 3: Tasks execute without dependency violations
Criterion 4: Task status is updated in real-time
Criterion 5: Failures are detected and workflow pauses (interactive) or aborts (--yolo)

description: Implement implementation review log generation
details: Create workflow phase that analyzes completed tasks, generates a comprehensive  review document, and saves it to the docs/ directory.
steps: Step 1: Retrieve all completed tasks from Vibe-Kanban
Step 2: Gather execution logs and results for each task
Step 3: Generate markdown review document with implementation details
Step 4: Include verification results and any issues encountered
Step 5: Save review log to docs/ directory with timestamp
acceptance: Criterion 1: Review document is generated after task execution
Criterion 2: Document includes all completed tasks with details
Criterion 3: Verification results are included
Criterion 4: File is saved to docs/ directory
Criterion 5: Document is human-readable markdown format

description: Implement cleanup and archival workflow phase
details: Create workflow phase that archives completed tasks, preserves artifacts, and  cleans up the workspace after successful completion.
steps: Step 1: Archive completed tasks in Vibe-Kanban (change status to archived)
Step 2: Create timestamped archive directory in archive/
Step 3: Copy all generated artifacts (PRD, tasks, review log) to archive
Step 4: Clean up temporary files and session state
Step 5: Generate completion summary with metrics
acceptance: Criterion 1: Tasks are archived in Vibe-Kanban
Criterion 2: Archive directory is created with proper timestamp
Criterion 3: All artifacts are preserved in archive/
Criterion 4: Temporary files are removed
Criterion 5: Completion summary shows success metrics

description: Implement project name resolution across all workflow phases
details: Ensure project_name is correctly resolved from CLI args, config, or defaults,  and is accessible to all skills and workflow phases without manual specification.
steps: Step 1: Implement project_name resolution logic with priority order
Step 2: Store resolved project_name in workflow context
Step 3: Pass project_name to all skill invocations
Step 4: Verify Vibe-Kanban operations use correct project
Step 5: Add validation that project_name is never undefined
acceptance: Criterion 1: project_name is resolved according to priority order
Criterion 2: All skill invocations receive project_name
Criterion 3: Vibe-Kanban operations target correct project
Criterion 4: No phase requires manual project specification
Criterion 5: Validation prevents undefined project_name

description: Implement interactive mode with user prompts and confirmations
details: Add interactive prompts for workflow phases, allowing users to review outputs  before proceeding, and provide clear status updates.
steps: Step 1: Add confirmation prompt after PRD generation
Step 2: Add confirmation prompt before task execution
Step 3: Display progress indicators for each phase
Step 4: Implement pause-on-failure behavior with user options
Step 5: Add final summary display with completion metrics
acceptance: Criterion 1: User is prompted for confirmation at key phases
Criterion 2: Progress indicators show current phase and status
Criterion 3: On failure, user can choose to abort or continue
Criterion 4: Final summary displays all metrics clearly
Criterion 5: User experience is clear and intuitive

description: Implement --yolo automated mode with no user interaction
details: Add fully automated execution mode that proceeds through all phases without  prompts, suitable for CI/CD pipelines.
steps: Step 1: Detect --yolo flag from command arguments
Step 2: Skip all confirmation prompts automatically
Step 3: Implement automatic failure abort with non-zero exit code
Step 4: Generate structured output report (JSON or text)
Step 5: Log all operations for debugging purposes
acceptance: Criterion 1: --yolo flag is correctly detected
Criterion 2: No prompts or user interaction occurs
Criterion 3: Failures result in immediate abort with exit code 1
Criterion 4: Structured report is generated
Criterion 5: All operations are logged

description: Implement timeout enforcement and time tracking
details: Add logic to track execution time and abort workflow if it exceeds 10-minute  constraint, with clear timeout error messages.
steps: Step 1: Start timer when workflow begins
Step 2: Check elapsed time before each phase
Step 3: Abort workflow if timeout exceeded
Step 4: Display clear timeout error with diagnostic info
Step 5: Include execution time in completion summary
acceptance: Criterion 1: Timer starts at workflow initiation
Criterion 2: Timeout is checked before each phase
Criterion 3: Workflow aborts after 10 minutes
Criterion 4: Timeout error message is clear and actionable
Criterion 5: Execution time is reported in summary

description: Implement error handling and recovery guidance
details: Add comprehensive error handling throughout workflow with clear error messages  and actionable guidance for common failures.
steps: Step 1: Wrap each workflow phase in try-catch blocks
Step 2: Detect common failure scenarios (Vibe-Kanban unavailable, skill errors, etc.)
Step 3: Generate clear error messages with context
Step 4: Provide actionable guidance for each error type
Step 5: Log errors for debugging
acceptance: Criterion 1: All phases have error handling
Criterion 2: Common failures are detected specifically
Criterion 3: Error messages include context and cause
Criterion 4: Guidance suggests concrete next steps
Criterion 5: Errors are logged with full details

description: Test BRD to PRD transformation end-to-end
details: Verify that test-brd.md is correctly transformed into a valid PRD with all  required sections, using both interactive and --yolo modes.
steps: Step 1: Execute BRD to PRD phase in interactive mode
Step 2: Verify PRD is generated with correct structure
Step 3: Validate all required sections are present
Step 4: Execute BRD to PRD phase in --yolo mode
Step 5: Confirm both modes produce equivalent output
acceptance: Criterion 1: PRD is generated successfully in both modes
Criterion 2: All required sections exist in generated PRD
Criterion 3: PRD content is properly formatted markdown
Criterion 4: Project name is correctly resolved
Criterion 5: No errors occur during transformation

description: Test PRD to tasks conversion and Vibe-Kanban integration
details: Verify that generated PRD is correctly broken down into tasks and tasks are  created in Vibe-Kanban with proper dependencies.
steps: Step 1: Execute PRD to tasks phase with generated PRD
Step 2: Verify tasks JSON is generated with correct structure
Step 3: Confirm tasks are created in Vibe-Kanban
Step 4: Validate task dependencies are correctly set
Step 5: Check all task metadata (category, priority, status)
acceptance: Criterion 1: Tasks JSON is generated successfully
Criterion 2: All tasks appear in Vibe-Kanban
Criterion 3: Dependencies are correctly represented
Criterion 4: Task metadata matches specification
Criterion 5: Task count is reasonable for test feature

description: Test task execution with dependency ordering
details: Verify that tasks execute in correct dependency order without violations, and  task status is properly updated in Vibe-Kanban.
steps: Step 1: Execute task execution phase with created tasks
Step 2: Monitor execution order and verify dependencies are respected
Step 3: Confirm task status updates in Vibe-Kanban
Step 4: Verify no dependency violations occur
Step 5: Check that all tasks complete successfully
acceptance: Criterion 1: Tasks execute in dependency order
Criterion 2: No task runs before its dependencies complete
Criterion 3: Task status is updated in real-time
Criterion 4: All tasks reach 'completed' status
Criterion 5: Execution logs are generated correctly

description: Test implementation review generation
details: Verify that implementation review document is generated with comprehensive  details about completed tasks and verification results.
steps: Step 1: Execute implementation review phase after task completion
Step 2: Verify review document is created in docs/
Step 3: Check document contains all completed tasks
Step 4: Validate verification results are included
Step 5: Confirm document is readable markdown format
acceptance: Criterion 1: Review document is generated
Criterion 2: File is saved to docs/ directory
Criterion 3: All completed tasks are documented
Criterion 4: Verification results are clear and detailed
Criterion 5: Document format is valid markdown

description: Test cleanup and archival process
details: Verify that cleanup phase properly archives tasks, preserves artifacts, and  cleans workspace without data loss.
steps: Step 1: Execute cleanup phase after workflow completion
Step 2: Verify tasks are archived in Vibe-Kanban
Step 3: Confirm archive directory is created with artifacts
Step 4: Check all artifacts are preserved (PRD, tasks, review)
Step 5: Validate temporary files are removed
acceptance: Criterion 1: Tasks status changes to archived
Criterion 2: Archive directory exists with timestamp
Criterion 3: All artifacts are copied to archive
Criterion 4: No data loss occurs
Criterion 5: Workspace is clean after cleanup

description: Test project name resolution across all skills
details: Verify that project_name is correctly resolved and used by all skills and  workflow phases without manual specification.
steps: Step 1: Test with explicit --project-name argument
Step 2: Test with project name in config file
Step 3: Test with default project name
Step 4: Verify each skill receives correct project_name
Step 5: Confirm Vibe-Kanban operations target correct project
acceptance: Criterion 1: CLI argument takes priority
Criterion 2: Config file is used when no CLI arg
Criterion 3: Default is used when neither exists
Criterion 4: All skills receive project_name correctly
Criterion 5: No manual specification is required

description: Test interactive mode user experience
details: Verify that interactive mode provides clear prompts, progress indicators, and  allows user control at key decision points.
steps: Step 1: Execute complete workflow in interactive mode
Step 2: Verify prompts appear at correct phases
Step 3: Test user confirmation flow (approve/reject)
Step 4: Validate progress indicators display correctly
Step 5: Confirm final summary is displayed
acceptance: Criterion 1: Prompts appear after PRD generation and before execution
Criterion 2: User can approve or reject at each prompt
Criterion 3: Progress indicators show current phase
Criterion 4: Final summary displays all metrics
Criterion 5: User experience is intuitive and clear

description: Test --yolo automated mode
details: Verify that --yolo mode executes entire workflow without user interaction and is   suitable for CI/CD pipelines.
steps: Step 1: Execute complete workflow with --yolo flag
Step 2: Verify no prompts or user interaction occurs
Step 3: Confirm workflow completes automatically
Step 4: Test failure scenario returns non-zero exit code
Step 5: Validate structured report is generated
acceptance: Criterion 1: No prompts appear during execution
Criterion 2: Workflow completes without user input
Criterion 3: Success returns exit code 0
Criterion 4: Failure returns exit code 1
Criterion 5: Report contains all necessary information

description: Test timeout enforcement and time tracking
details: Verify that workflow aborts after 10 minutes and execution time is accurately  tracked and reported.
steps: Step 1: Execute workflow with simulated delay
Step 2: Verify workflow aborts at 10-minute mark
Step 3: Check timeout error message is clear
Step 4: Test normal execution includes time tracking
Step 5: Confirm execution time in completion summary
acceptance: Criterion 1: Workflow aborts after 10 minutes
Criterion 2: Timeout error is clear and actionable
Criterion 3: Execution time is tracked accurately
Criterion 4: Time is displayed in completion summary
Criterion 5: No false timeout triggers for normal execution

description: Test error handling and recovery guidance
details: Verify that common error scenarios are handled gracefully with clear messages  and actionable guidance.
steps: Step 1: Test Vibe-Kanban unavailable scenario
Step 2: Test invalid BRD file scenario
Step 3: Test skill execution failure scenario
Step 4: Verify error messages are clear with context
Step 5: Confirm recovery guidance is actionable
acceptance: Criterion 1: Vibe-Kanban errors show connection guidance
Criterion 2: Invalid file errors show format requirements
Criterion 3: Skill failures show diagnostic information
Criterion 4: All errors include clear context
Criterion 5: Guidance suggests concrete next steps

description: End-to-end integration test of complete workflow
details: Execute complete SDLC workflow from BRD to cleanup in both interactive and  --yolo modes, verifying all acceptance criteria.
steps: Step 1: Run complete workflow in interactive mode
Step 2: Verify all acceptance criteria (AC-001 through AC-008)
Step 3: Check execution time is under 10 minutes
Step 4: Run complete workflow in --yolo mode
Step 5: Confirm both modes complete successfully with identical outcomes
acceptance: Criterion 1: All workflow phases complete without errors
Criterion 2: All 8 acceptance criteria are met
Criterion 3: Execution time is under 10 minutes
Criterion 4: Both modes produce equivalent results
Criterion 5: All artifacts are correctly generated and archived

description: Document test workflow usage and command reference
details: Create comprehensive documentation for the test workflow command, including  usage examples, arguments, and expected behavior.
steps: Step 1: Document command syntax and all arguments
Step 2: Provide usage examples for both interactive and --yolo modes
Step 3: Explain workflow phases and what each does
Step 4: Document expected outputs and artifacts
Step 5: Add to Ralph's main documentation
acceptance: Criterion 1: Command syntax is clearly documented
Criterion 2: Usage examples cover common scenarios
Criterion 3: All workflow phases are explained
Criterion 4: Expected outputs are documented
Criterion 5: Documentation is integrated into Ralph docs

description: Document expected outputs and artifact formats
details: Create documentation describing all generated artifacts (PRD, tasks, review log,   archive) with format specifications and examples.
steps: Step 1: Document PRD format and required sections
Step 2: Document tasks JSON schema and structure
Step 3: Document review log format and contents
Step 4: Document archive structure and organization
Step 5: Provide example outputs for each artifact
acceptance: Criterion 1: All artifact formats are documented
Criterion 2: Schema/structure specifications are clear
Criterion 3: Example outputs are provided
Criterion 4: Documentation explains artifact purpose
Criterion 5: Format requirements are testable

description: Create troubleshooting guide for common issues
details: Document common failure scenarios, their causes, and step-by-step resolution  procedures.
steps: Step 1: List common error scenarios from testing
Step 2: Document root causes for each scenario
Step 3: Provide step-by-step resolution procedures
Step 4: Add debugging tips and diagnostic commands
Step 5: Include FAQ section with quick answers
acceptance: Criterion 1: Common errors are documented with examples
Criterion 2: Root causes are clearly explained
Criterion 3: Resolution procedures are step-by-step
Criterion 4: Debugging tips are actionable
Criterion 5: FAQ covers most common questions
